hints.content:
First, let's find the number of students who choose green and blue as their favorite color.


[[☃ image 1]]

Color | Number of Students
- | - | -
$\greenD{\text{Green}}$ | $15$ students
$\blueD{\text{Blue}}$ | $11$ students
$\redD{\text{Red}}$ | $?$

options.alt: A bar graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Number of Students and the vertical axis labeled Favorite Color. The horizontal axis is labeled, from left to right: 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, and 16. The vertical axis is labeled from the bottom of the axis to the top of the axis as follows: green, blue, purple, orange, and red. The bar line for each favorite color shows the following: green bar line extends to the middle of 14 and 16, blue bar line extends to the middle of 10 and 12, purple bar line extends to 6, orange bar line extends to 8, and red bar line is labeled with a question mark. A green line  is drawn up from the middle of 14 and 16, which reaches to the end of green bar labeled 15. A blue line is drawn up from the middle of 10 and 12, which reaches to the end of blue bar labeled 11. !

hints.content:
Now, let's find the number of students who chose red as their favorite color.

The value is the same as the difference between the number of students who chose green and blue as their favorite color, so we need to subtract.

$\begin{align}
\greenD{\text{Green}} - \blueD{\text{Blue}} &= \redD{\text{Red}}\\\\
\greenD{15} - \blueD{11} &={} \redD{?}\\\\
\redD{\text{Red}}&=\redD{4}
\end{align}$
There were $\redD4$ students who chose red as their favorite color.
